identified-content.person: Edwards, Dr. Eki Shola (Dr. Eki Shola Abrams)

block.p: Dr. Eki Shola Edwards and William Bradley Abrams were married yesterday at Coyaba Beach Resort & Club in Montego Bay, Jamaica. Seymour N. Whitter, a civil registrar of marriages for Hanover Parish, officiated.

Dr. Abrams, 30, is completing an internship at North Shore University Hospital in Manhasset, N.Y. In July she is to become a resident in anesthesiology at Mount Sinai Medical Center in Manhattan. She graduated from Cornell and received a medical degree from the Mount Sinai School of Medicine.

Dr. Eki Shola Edwards and William Bradley Abrams were married yesterday at Coyaba Beach Resort & Club in Montego Bay, Jamaica. Seymour N. Whitter, a civil registrar of marriages for Hanover Parish, officiated.

Dr. Eki Shola Edwards and William Bradley Abrams were married yesterday at Coyaba Beach Resort & Club in Montego Bay, Jamaica. Seymour N. Whitter, a civil registrar of marriages for Hanover Parish, officiated.

Dr. Abrams, 30, is completing an internship at North Shore University Hospital in Manhasset, N.Y. In July she is to become a resident in anesthesiology at Mount Sinai Medical Center in Manhattan. She graduated from Cornell and received a medical degree from the Mount Sinai School of Medicine.

She is a daughter of Hope and Montrose Edwards of Central Islip, N.Y. The bride's father is a special education teacher at Frederick Douglass Academy VI, a high school in Far Rockaway, Queens. Her mother is a social worker at the Lindenhurst, N.Y., site of Just Kids Early Childhood Learning Center.
Mr. Abrams, 36, is a marketing strategy manager for the College Board, in Manhattan. He graduated from Indiana University and received an M.B.A. from the University of San Francisco.

He is the son of Katherine and Barry Abrams of Kiawah Island, S.C. The bridegroom's mother retired as the general counsel for the northeast area of Verizon Wireless, in Morristown, N.J. His father, who is also retired, was a vice president and the general counsel for the New Jersey unit of Verizon, working in Newark and Arlington, Va.
